results.title: Cityscape: impressions of a city
results.creator_credit: Ryan Larkin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment, from NFB’s animation workshop, in creating continuous metamorphoses on the screen, employing charcoal drawings on a white board in a process of erasing, adding, photographing. In this film there is the impression of a succession of creatures moving across the screen, then disappearing into a hole. Eventually the hole changes to a bridge on which stands the youth who began the parade. Animation by Ryan Larkin. (Award: San Francisco)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ryan Larkin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: City under pressure
results.creator_credit: Theodore Conant, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A case study of municipal government and the influence of citizens acting as a group. The study is of Edmonton, Canada, but the problems shown are common to many cities - urban renewal, traffic congestion, zoning etc. Listens in on discussion of these questions in Edmonton to provide ground for further discussion by the audience.

results.title: City slickers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Irby Smith, Castle Rock, Face Production and Nelson Entertainment
results.brief_description: Boss breathing down your neck? Bank manager screaming? Family driving you crazy? Then it’s about time you took a break on the the wild west side! Die hard city fellas Mitch, Phil and Ed are edging 40 and desperately searching for their lost youth. When they try to recapture it with a two week cattle-driving vacation in the midwest they discover that playing cowboy is more than just ridin’, ropin’, and sleepin’ out under the stars. These city slickers thought surviving mid-life crisis was tough. That’s nothing compared to the ride they’re about to take. Stars Billy Crystal and Jack Palance in an endearing and funny adventure that will have the whole family in stitches.

results.title: City sailors
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, R. Maslyn Williams and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Shows Sydney Harbour with its wide scope for sailing, the innumerable bays and inlets which provide safe mooring and the warm sunlit days which have made sailing a popular summer pastime. Commentator: James Dibble.

results.title: City of many faces
results.creator_credit: David Bennett, Lew Parry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Mountain-fringed, poised on the Pacific, Vancouver is endowed with the natural beauty of flowers, parks and beaches. But even more in the forefront is summer skiing, yachting on the Strait, football at Empire Stadium, plays and concerts at the Queen Elizabeth Theater, and visits to the ever-fascinating zoo in Stanley Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bennett, Lew Parry and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: City of gold
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A nostalgic recollection of the period when the Yukon gold fever was at its height. The commentary, written and spoken by Dawson-born Pierre Berton, begins with childhood recollections of the writer. This feeling of retrospect is further deepened by the introduction of many vintage photographs which give the film a documentary quality as it reviews the history of the gold rush. We see relics of the old Dawson as it was when all the gold of the rich river beds flowed through its stores, taverns and dance halls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: City of dreams: the collaboration of Marion Mahon and Walter Burley Griffin
results.creator_credit: Belinda Mason, Gaby Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Walter Burley Griffin and Marion Mahony have long enjoyed accolades as one of the most important artistic collaborations of the 20th Century. In this documentary an overview of the collaboration of Walter Burley Griffin and wife and architectural partner Marion Mahony is addressed. The documentary connects the historical time-line of events in their lives to not only inform us about the architecture, but the political environment and the role that their personal dynamics had in contributing to their work. From early beginnings as the world’s first registered women architect and long-time designer for Frank Lloyd Wright, Marion Mahony is described as being Griffin’s intellectual sparring partner, muse and mentor. Documented is the incredible political corruption that Walter and Marion were confronted with and endured in Australia once being awarded the prize for their design of the new capital. Although they both decided to stay on in Australia after Canberra was completed and together produced almost 300 buildings around the country (including Sydney’s Castlecrag), it is evident that both lives suffered as a result of their ongoing battles with bureaucracy over the building of Canberra. What Marion and Walter have left is a legacy of strong vision and philosophical interest. Their dedication to their dream and aesthetic that sensitively addressed the environment and the balance of humans within this remains in their gardens and buildings.
results.title_for_label: City of dreams: the collaboration of Marion Mahon and Walter Burley Griffin

results.title: City life
results.brief_description: A light-hearted sketch of life in the city of Sydney. The hazards of driving and parking a car in the city area and the people in Hyde Park are seen against a background of light music. No narration.

results.title: City in siege
results.creator_credit: Allen Stark, James Parker, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A record of Winnipeg’s ordeal by flood in the spring of 1950. From the first overflowing drain to the broad sea that the Red River finally became, the film traces the course of this disaster. Scenes of wholesale destruction are matched by pictures of heroic rescue and defence work. When the waters recede we enter sodden houses to find mouldy walls, slimy floors and rotting furniture. But the film does not end on a note of despair - our last view of the flood area shows the work of reconstruction beginning with the removal of dykes and the restoration of roads. Voice and narration by Jack Scott. Photography by Robert Campbell and Hector Lemieux.

results.title: Citizens in uniform
results.brief_description: The soldier of the Bundeswehr has to submit to a hard training suitable to meet the requirements of a technical age. He also has rights which underline his equal position as a citizen. As a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the German Republic must contribute its share against the Communist threat.
